H347.def: = man; ◄ from the land of {L:Uz<SDBH:עוּץ>}; ► main character of book of Job

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H4405.def: used in poetry only; = a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used to form sentences with others

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H3932.def: only used in poetry; = action by which humans or deities express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H4069.def: = a reference to the cause, reason or purpose of an event; normally used in  questions with the purpose of identifying that cause, reason, or purpose; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that these things cannot be identified

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H6437.def: = action by which humans or animals turn their body to face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H8074.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H926.def: = action by which humans or divine beings act quickly

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H6427.def: = process by which the human body shakes, ◄ as a result of fear

H4069.def: = a reference to the cause, reason or purpose of an event; normally used in  questions with the purpose of identifying that cause, reason, or purpose; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that these things cannot be identified

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H2421.def: = process by which humans are alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

H6275.def: = process by which rocks move spontaneously from one place to another

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H1396.def: = process by which humans gain strength, power, and authority, which enables them to do things that others are unable to accomplish

H2233.def: = a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H6631.def: = object which derives from or comes from another object, used for plants and, by extension, for humans

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H6343.def: = process by which humans tremble or shake, ◄ as a result of a strong emotion of fear and concern for one's safety

H7626.def: = stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1602.def: = state in which humans or deities are deeply revulsed by other humans or deities, as if they are dirty

H6403.def: = process by which humans find safety from a dangerous or life-threatening situation

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H3206.def: = posterity of humans and or animals of undetermined sex, at an age ranging from before birth to adulthood

H7540.def: = action with which humans or animals move in a quick and light or lively way

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H8596.def: = musical instrument, consisting of a membrane, usually of animal skin, which was stretched over a shallow circular, triangular, or square frame; ► it was struck sharply with one or two hands, depending on where it was situated; it could be held in one hand, under the arm, or against the chest and struck with the other hand, or it could be held on the knees or the ground and struck with one or two hands; the fingers of one hand could be used to tighten or loosen the tension on the membrane as it was struck

H3658.def: = musical instrument consisting of a sound box ◄ made of wood, out of the ends or sides of which projected two arms; the arms supported a crosspiece; strings descended from the crosspiece over the sound box and the number of strings could vary; ► often used to accompany singing

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H5748.def: = wood-wind instrument; ≈ its music is associated with joy and well-being

H1086.def: = process by which objects lose their quality and strength due to continued use; ≈ used figuratively to denote the loss of a person's vitality

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5181.def: = action by which humans or supernatural beings move down from a place of higher elevation

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H7281.def: = a very short length of time

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H2654.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H5647.def: = state in which humans, either as individuals or as groups, are in a position of subservience towards (other) individuals or groups, which is normally accompanied by a number of duties, tasks and obligations

H3276.def: = process by which someone's well-being is promoted by a certain action or event

H6293.def: = process by which humans or animals unexpectedly meet other humans or animals while travelling from one location to another

H2898.def: = state in which objects are of a high quality and/or a pleasure to look at

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H1846.def: = process by which a fire or light is put out; ≈ associated with the beginning of difficult times, and sometimes even death

H343.def: = extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H2505.def: = causative action by which humans or deities divide an object (or range of objects) into portions; ► usually with the intention to use one or more of these portions for a particular purpose

H8401.def: = dried stalks of grain and grasses, usually left over from harvesting grain ► used as food for animals or as an ingredient for making clay bricks; ≈ associated with something of little value

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H4671.def: = debris and husks crushed and separated from grain and carried away by the wind when threshing and winnowing ≈ associated especially with the transient nature and disappearance of evil people and enemies.

H1589.def: = action by which humans secretly take possession of objects belonging to someone else, and sometimes even of other humans, without permission or legal right and usually without intending to return it

H5492.def: = process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God and used as a symbol of warfare and hardship

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6845.def: = action by which humans hide themselves ► in order to attack another person

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H3589.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H2656.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H4557.def: = an oral or written account of something

H2320.def: = period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon

H2686.def: = action by which insects divides themselves into orderly groups ◄ like an army

H3925.def: = process by which humans or animals acquire knowledge or skill from an identified or unidentified source, ► which usually results in a specific behavior or skill

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H8537.def: literally: completeness; hence: = state in which humans are considered morally blameless, with profound moral uprightness and integrity

H7961.def: = state in which humans can live without fear or concerns, which is either or not appropriate depending on the situation

H5845.def: meaning unsure: = part of the human body, possibly the side or the thigh; ≈ used metonymically to refer to the entire body

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H2461.def: = white fluid; ◄ secreted by women and female mammals; ► for nourishment of their children or young; also used as food for humans; ≈ highly appreciated and considered high quality food; associated with delight, whiteness, purity, wealth, and well-being; metaphor for beauty, young age; quality, wealth, and sex

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H8248.def: = state in which objects contain a certain amount of moisture

H4221.def: = a soft fatty substance in the cavities of bones; ≈ associated with health and vigor

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H4751.def: = a small quantity of a liquid

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H7901.def: = state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H7415.def: = small, soft, legless, tube-shaped creatures that have no bones or shells; they typically feed on overripe fruit, rotting meat, and similar things; most are larvae that hatch from the eggs laid by flies or some beetles; associated with uncleanness, mortality, decay, and death

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4284.def: = procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind

H4209.def: = plan or strategy thought out by humans or deities to accomplish a certain goal; ≈ when used for humans, only used in a negative sense

H2554.def: = action by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans with which they have a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich themselves in one way or another

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H346.def: = a reference to an unknown location; normally used with the purpose of finding out which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H5081.def: = state in which humans are willing to perform a certain task and show that by their actions

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H4908.def: = location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H5234.def: = process by which humans understand the identity or nature of (other) humans, objects or events

H226.def: = an object that represents and identifies a group of people; in the form of a flag or a metal or wooden board, often with an image; attached to a pole so that it can be carried; used in both military and religious contexts

H2820.def: = causative action by which human or deities keep something to themselves, refusing to give it to someone else

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H343.def: = extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death

H2986.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or inanimate objects to move or be moved from one place to another

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H2986.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or inanimate objects to move or be moved from one place to another

H6913.def: = place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness

H8245.def: = state in which humans are unable to sleep

H1430.def: = a pile of bundles of harvested ears of grain

H5158.def: = a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season

H4985.def: = state in which food tastes well

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H4900.def: = state in which humans are of more than average height{N:001}

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H4557.def: = an oral or written account of something

H5162.def: = causative action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

H1892.def: = a slight movement of air; ≈ associated with something without substance, that quickly passes away

H4604.def: = action by which humans do something to (other) humans or deities that is not in line with the behavior that they committed themselves to
